organic_results.title: An unconventional setting for a conventional occasion: A case study of an experimental adult education program
organic_results.snippet: This paper explores how specific settings may bear upon the nature of a social event through the ways in which settings routinely are taken into account by persons in those settings. Data from an experimental adult basic education program are presented to point out some observable intrusions of a setting into social action. A number of possible conclusions concerning the relationship of settings and social events are indicated and discussed. Included among these are implications regarding setting awareness and …

publication_info.summary: JJ Driessen, JN Pyfer - Sociology of education, 1975 - JSTOR
